location.description: By water just before enter inner city zone

npc.notes: Squints and turns head. 'By the gods, such twisted aura this has! To see it hurts my eyes. I will help you if for no other reason than to remove such twisted thing from existence.' Unrolls scroll from pack and softly chants over dark metal shield. Hands it back with exhausted smile. 'Your heart seems pure. If I was able to help at all, I am honored. May light shine warmly upon you.'

steps.notes: Identifies as 'glowing with a bright light'. Light of clean spirit isn't object - it's literal 'clean spirit' of Elia the Pure

steps.description: Give three Gleaming Crested items to Reklon Gnallen

npc.name: Reklon Gnallen
npc.notes: Says 'I never thought our order would see these artifacts again. With return of these relics we can now put at ease scar upon history of our order. This cleansing will atone for his failure. Your soul must be pure to have given so freely of yourself. Go now, take this crested token of our order. If you wish to free his soul you must undertake another sacrifice.' 'Only this crest and sacrifice of something that symbolizes your strength and purity will release his spirit into cleansing flames of our lady Quellious. Go now.'

steps.notes: Identifies as 'Mark of Peace'. Symbol of strength and purity refers to Fiery Avenger

'Your selflessness has made it possible to redeem my honor. With cleansing of my corruption your own soul has been strengthened. Your power comes from your devotion to your god and with this you have been rewarded. Remember always your purity, devotion, and why you have sacrificed. I must go now to sacrifice myself upon the spear of pain.'

Sword you hold in hands is one of oldest blades known, even to eldest. To strike at darkest heart of evil requires weapon beyond this, or even ones you may carry at side. First task, first preparation you must make is smithing of that blade. Its edge sharpened, its balance made perfect. When you have finished, bring me this sword again.'

npc.name: Telin Darkforest
npc.notes: Smiles slowly. 'Now that's fine work. Just a moment, we have friend here who can enchant one of blades. Give her blade the ancient smithed.'

steps.description: Give Refined Ancient Sword to Faelin Bloodbriar

npc.name: Faelin Bloodbriar
npc.notes: Smiles at you, then closes eyes as sets gem 'Nature's Balance' into crossguard and begins to channel spirit into sword. Ground rumbles loudly as casts. Collapses in exhaustion after short time. 'Take blade, and perhaps you can finish this. You must strike at Innoruuk's heart. Bring his shattered gem and Mithril blade to Xanuusus. Only with Innoruuk's death can balance of land once again be restored. If we do not meet again, remember you always have my eternal thanks.' Despawns after saying stuff about how have to kill Innoruuk to rebalance world

location.description: Treant

npc.notes: Waves hands over gem of corruption and wave of warm energy passes through area. With care for such huge creature, melds gem into sword and seems to glow all over as channels energy into weapon. 'Thus is link of hate broken between Innoruuk and spirit of earth. Through your will has balance returned. Your deeds, your work for good of all, will be remembered by anyone who walks beneath canopy of forest or roams plains. Continue your vigil over nature's balance.'

steps.description: Give Darkforge Breastplate, Darkforge Greaves, Darkforge Helm, and 900 Platinum to Kurron Ni

npc.name: Kurron Ni
npc.notes: Can get armor through Darkforge Armor Quests. Says 'Well done, I honestly didn't expect to see you again. Yes, yes, this is perfect! My mission is nearly complete!' Then attacks: 'My mission was to find pathetic shadowknight and bring him closer to Innoruuk. You volunteered. By exercising my superior powers of persuasion, I have now taken from you fine suit of armor and enough coin to ensure that I will be sleeping neither soberly nor alone for quite some time! Now I ask you, worthy shadowknight, do you not feel fires of hatred coursing through your veins like never before? That is very reward I spoke of! You have been brought closer to my master. My mission is complete! You foolish excuse for dark knight, I shall take your head and tell all of your generous donation to mighty Teir'Dal rogues!'

steps.description: Kill Kurron Ni

mob.name: Kurron Ni

steps.notes: Letter reads: 'Duriek, I have searched this godless pit for what seems to be an eternity with nothing to show for my efforts. I pray to Innoruuk that you have made some breakthrough in your research. Please update me as to your progress. In the meanwhile I have run into some unexpected expenses and will need some funds to carry on. An additional ten thousand should suffice. Regards, Karnett'

steps.description: Give Letter to Duriek to Duriek Bloodpool in Paineel

npc.name: Duriek Bloodpool
npc.notes: Says 'Yes, most unfortunate. I was informed last week of death of my most recent apprentice. A few months ago, I paid substantial sum to group of rogues sent from Neriak to collect on gambling debt. He swore to me that was end of it, but I suspected otherwise. My warnings of gambling with rogues fell on deaf ears.' Despite what Duriek tells you, receive neither item nor money. Says 'Hmm, you seem bit green and I hesitate to trust you with such important work, but time is of essence as my days in this world are running out. Bring me back bottle of cough elixir and, if you are still interested, I will instruct you further.'

steps.description: Give 1000 Platinum to Smaka in Neriak Foreign Quarter

npc.name: Smaka
dialogue: Say 'I need a bottle of cough elixir'
npc.notes: Says 'Ahh, you want me cure?! It cost lots of money, big big secret it is. Only us ogres know how to make. You wants? Only 1000 platinum! Make you feels bedder in no times!'

steps.description: Give Cough Elixir to Duriek Bloodpool

npc.name: Duriek Bloodpool
npc.notes: Says 'Thank you. Now, quickly, there is not much time for me. What I tell you here now must never be shared with another soul. I have spent better part of my life piecing together clues for creation of legendary dark blade, corrupted Ghoulbane. I am very close to understanding method used in manipulating enchantments of Ghoulbane, but in my current condition, I cannot finish collecting research. My previous apprentice was searching for this last clue when he met untimely demise.' 'I possess key that will open sealed tome to be found somewhere in ruins uncovered here not long ago. Recover that tome for me and I am certain I will be able to corrupt Ghoulbane. My name will be etched in history and you will wield legend! You must hurry now, and I must return to my studies. Do not return to me without tome.'

steps.description: Kill A Ratman Guard in The Hole

mob.name: A Ratman Guard

location.description: Patrol jail area together with ratman warriors

mob.notes: Level 55 warrior. Is not immune from any spells. Approximate forces required: two 50+ groups

steps.description: Give Dusty Tome to Duriek Bloodpool

npc.name: Duriek Bloodpool
npc.notes: Gasps at you in astonishment, eyes beaming with pride and says, 'You've found it! It seems I underestimated you. You have succeeded where others failed. I feared it would never come to pass.' Takes key from neck, softly muttering some words, and places it in previously unseen keyhole. Book's hinges creak as pulls it open. After reading for few moments, says, 'It is even better than I had hoped! It will take me weeks to uncover portion of what this book has to offer. But this is what I have been searching for, so many years! At last I know items required to corrupt that accursed blade!' 'I will need Ghoulbane, Soul Leech, Blade of Abrogation, and Decrepit Sheath. Alas, I am far too ill to travel and collect these pieces. I must call upon your youth and ability again. Return to me with these items and I shall be known throughout history as greatest grave lord to have walked Norrath and you shall be among most powerful in our art.'

npc.notes: IMPORTANT - Feign Death WILL NOT WORK. Open trade window and hit hide and ensure con 'indifferent' to Teydar. Says 'I did it! Pieces you got me were perfect! It took huge effort on my part to craft this, of course. It saddens me that I'm unable to keep one of my best works. Deal is deal. There is honor among shadowknights.'

steps.description: Give Ghoulbane, Soul Leech, Blade of Abrogation, and Decrepit Sheath to Duriek Bloodpool

npc.name: Duriek Bloodpool
npc.notes: IMPORTANT: Open trade then hide make sure con's indifferent then hit trade. Takes Ghoulbane and places other swords on either side of it. Sheath begins to gleam so intensely, can see bones inside Duriek's hands. After several minutes, there is final, blinding flash. Duriek collapses to ground. After few moments, Duriek motions you closer and whispers, 'You have done well. I wish fate had been kinder to me and allowed me your aid years ago--I might have lived long enough to enjoy fame of our combined efforts. I studied much of tome you retrieved and have stumbled upon something that may be key to unleashing darkness upon face of Norrath forever. You must seek out powerful lich by name of Lhranc. Farewell.' With last bit of energy, Duriek places corrupted Ghoulbane in your hands. Duriek then dies after giving you Corrupted Ghoulbane

give_items: Soul Leech, Dark Sword of Blood

steps.description: Talk to Knarthenne Skurl in Toxxulia Forest

npc.name: Knarthenne Skurl

location.description: Near dock

npc.notes: Says 'Ah, you do not possess heart of innocent. Be gone with you!' 'What's that? Heart of Innocent, you say?! Ages, it has been, since I was last asked that. Heart of Innocent is item of great power. Few are they who have ever commanded dark magic of such object. It is bound soul of pure mortal, rare indeed. Take this hollow gem, and combine with it heart of one who is pure. If your hand is steady and your mind is clear, you shall have what you seek.'

steps.description: OPTIONAL: Talk to Marl Kastane in Kerra Isle

npc.name: Marl Kastane
dialogue: Say 'I have the will of Innoruuk'
npc.notes: OPTIONAL step. Says 'Begone!! You do not have will to do things I require!' 'You speak of myth, friend. Such object does not exist in this age and secret of its creation lies locked in my mind, where it shall stay. It has been passed down through generations in my line, not to be revealed to soul until prophecy has come to pass.' 'My apologies, I have said too much already. Instead, I have errand to occupy your thoughts. Take this as proof that you are sent from me and find my brother in Paineel. I haven't spoken with him in some time now and his well being is essential to our family's destiny.'

npc.name: Gerot Kastane

location.description: Past elevator

npc.notes: Says 'At last! I have been waiting for my brother for weeks! We are doomed! Innoruuk will taint our seed into some perverse, twisted, maddened breed. Prophecy has begun to unfold and there are none capable of stopping it. Quickly, return this note to Marl, we must hide! We have failed master! We must escape hateful one's wrath!'

Kill A Mimic in The Hole

location.description: Jail cell

npc.notes: IMPORTANT: When doing any sort of turn in/hand in for epic quest, whether spawning Kyrenna or turning in Dark Shroud etc... MAKE 100% CERTAIN that indifferent to NPC doing hand in with. Can do this by putting item(s) in trade window, then using Hide skill or have someone cast invis (or IVU for Glohnor). Again, make absolutely certain npc cons indifferent before click trade or item(s) will be gobbled up. If already indifferent, best bet is use hide/invis/ivu and consider another npc (or better still, mob) to be sure. Says 'Please help me get out of here! My companion, Kyrenna, and I are trapped in this hellish place!' 'I was with Kyrenna when she attempted to revive corpse of Glohnor the Valiant. Like fools, we rushed into trap. Now we sit here and await our deaths.' 'She is close by. For price, I shall tell you. Bring me key to my freedom and I will betray her, who sentenced me to this fate.'

steps.notes: Caradon says 'Kyrenna! We are free!' Then both attack

steps.description: Kill Kyrenna (NOT Caradon if can be avoided)

mob.notes: Level 55 cleric. Caradon is level 55 paladin. Two kill them both need two full level 50-60 groups. Caradon and Kyrenna both immune to any spells so need many tanks and many clerics (This is not true, see Wedar's Guide to The Hole for tips on fight)

npc.notes: DONT FEIGN DEATH FOR THIS TURN-IN. Must be Indifferent for this turn in (use 'Hide' skill). Make sure to be Hidden for this turn in. Says 'Here, you take this shroud. You must now find spirit of glohnor and place this item on him. This should force him back into mummified body and then you must destroy newly raised form and return to me its wrappings.'

steps.description: Give Head of Glohnor to Gerot Kastane

npc.name: Gerot Kastane
npc.notes: Make sure to con indifferent w/ hide! Says 'Good travels, dark one! May Innoruuk curse your enemies!'

steps.description: Give Glohnor Wrappings to Marl Kastane

npc.name: Marl Kastane
npc.notes: Make sure to con indifferent w/ hide! Says 'You've done it! Your efforts will stand as tribute to our kind for time eternal, my friend. Although nothing could possibly serve as just reward for your accomplishments, please accept this as well as my eternal gratitude. It has been fashioned from wraps of mummy and shall protect you well.'

steps.description: Combine Heart of Kyrenna with Soulcase
Give Corrupted Ghoulbane, Heart of the Innocent, Head of the Valiant, and Will of Innoruuk to Lhranc in City of Mist

npc.name: Lhranc

location.description: Center room on other side of wall that surrounds castle moat. Ghost

npc.notes: Make sure indifferent to him before hand in, have someone else cast IVU on you before hit trade. Says 'Ahh, at last I can free myself of this prison! Centuries have passed since I enjoyed fruits of mortality.' Hurls components above head where they remain suspended in midair. They hover in place while chants words of ancient spell. As speaks, items begin to rotate around head, slowly at first, then faster as chanting grows louder, until spins in blur. Soon, room is filled with deafening shriek that pierces you to core. Lhranc hurls coin at you and laughs, 'Here is your reward fool.' After brief pause: 'Young one, you cannot fathom how long it has been since I breathed air and felt flesh on my bones. I told you I would show you weapon that would make you most powerful of your kind. I said nothing of giving it to you. Feast your eyes on Innoruuk's Curse mortal, thank you for your service.' Lhranc will disappear and reappear as human. If have not become KoS at this point then Lhranc will now start attacking you

steps.description: Kill Lhranc

mob.name: Lhranc
mob.notes: Level 63 Shadow Knight. Harmtouches many times during fight and has buttload of hitpoints. Impossible to mesmerize him, slow him, or any other debuffs so have many, many, many clerics ready to use all their many healing. Need around 5-6 full groups of level 50-60s. If wipe in fight, Lhranc won't despawn. Bring at least 2 groups

steps.notes: Upon killing Lhranc, Marl Kastane appears nearby. Says 'Alas, I cannot be one to carry sword back to my people as proof in fear they will kill me to possess it for their own. I think simple trade is in order, perhaps you have symbol or token of Lhranc's that I could take back to others to ease their worries?' Hand Lhranc's Coin to Marl Kastane. Says 'Very good, I will go deliver this right away.'

location.description: Spawns after killing one of: Capt Surestout (Ocean of Tears +800, -5400), Blinde the Cutpurse (Rathe Mountains +3087, +1302), Peg Leg (Butcherblock Mountains +260, +1650), An Iksar Manslayer (Field of Bone - marauder cave)

shaman.faction_notes: Entire quest is faction based. Can skip latter parts by doing earlier steps over and over until max True Spirit faction. Once have max faction, can go straight to Lord Rak'Ashiir and turn in child's tear. DO NOT perform any quest turn-ins while using Form of the Bear or Form of the Great Bear. Being in illusion may bug quest NPCs to misread True Spirit faction. No level restriction for shaman epic quest. However, must be level 46 to enter Plane of Fear to get tear. Can get around this by having another player turn in tear and then loot scale. MUST get MAX ALLY with True Spirit before final turn in. If don't have max ally, scale will be eaten and will have to petition for spear.

mob.name: Capt Surestout / Blinde the Cutpurse / Peg Leg / An Iksar Manslayer

location.description: Capt Surestout: Ocean of Tears +800, -5400. Blinde: Rathe Mountains +3087, +1302. Peg Leg: Butcherblock Mountains +260, +1650. An Iksar Manslayer: Field of Bone marauder cave

steps.description: Talk to A Lesser Spirit

npc.name: A Lesser Spirit
npc.notes: Do not kill him. Says 'Did you take this person's life, shaman?' 'Why have you taken this person's life? Did he threaten your life? Did you dislike him? Or was his death profit to you in some way?' 'I see. It brings me sadness to see another die, but his heart was black and great nothingness. His body will become grass now. Thank you for what you have done, shaman.' 'What, or who, I am isn't as important as what, or who, WE are. Do you wish to know more, shaman?' 'That is good. Take this gem. It is part of us like clouds to sky and is wonderful gift from grandfather. Take this gem to where humans gather to spoil land and water. Some call it port. There you will find one of us, shaman like yourself. Give him gem and perhaps he will tell you more of spirits.'

steps.description: Give Tiny Gem to Bondl Felligan in North Freeport

npc.name: Bondl Felligan

location.description: Sewers in northwestern part of town (In river on way to WFP). Little ways in on inside of collapsed wall. May spawn in sewers, or may spawn at +30, +480 and path to inn

npc.notes: Says 'WOW, thanks! This must be worth fortune! I could drink for month after sellin' this to one of them fool merchants. I'm going to see how much I can get for it right now!' Wait for him to move and follow him out of sewers. There he will stop and speak: 'What!? You don't approve of me buyin' some drinks with this gem? Who heck are you to offer me gift and order me what to do with it? Is this some kinda conditional kindness? Well? Are you gonna let me buy some booze with this or not?' Say 'You can buy booze.' Suddenly becomes completely sober and says, 'Very well, shaman, please come with me.' Follow him to Jade Tiger's Den. Head up to second floor, middle room and go inside. There you'll find greater spirit waiting

steps.description: Talk to A Greater Spirit in Jade Tiger's Den

npc.name: A Greater Spirit

location.description: Jade Tiger's Den, second floor, middle room

dialogue: Say 'I follow justice' (Barbarian) / 'I follow war' (Ogre) / 'I follow fear' (Iksar) / 'I follow hate' (Troll)
npc.notes: Says 'Greetings, shaman. Tell me, do you follow [Justice], [War], [Fear], or [Hate]?' If Barbarian, choose justice. If Ogre, choose war. If Iksar, choose fear. If Troll, choose hate. Says 'Ah, follower of Tribunal from North you are, then. You would be best served by speaking to my brother in next room. Farewell.' Go to other room as instructed

steps.description: Talk to A Greater Spirit in other room

npc.name: A Greater Spirit

location.description: Other room in Jade Tiger's Den

dialogue: Say 'What trust do you speak of?'
Say 'I will walk the path of the Heyokah'
npc.notes: WARNING: DO NOT say 'I will walk the path of the Heyokah' until have received gem. Next line will cause spirit to immediately disappear but will start next part of quest. Says 'It is good to see you. We're glad you trusted in our brother and did what was asked regardless of Bondl's intentions. This fills us with joy, as [true spirits] work in ways most people would not understand and [trust] is first lesson of [Heyokah].'

steps.description: Give Opaque Gem to Ooglyn in Erud's Crossing

npc.name: Ooglyn

location.description: Female ogre shaman on island

npc.notes: Make sure have Spirit of Wolf, Levitation, and Enduring Breath (reagent Fish Scales) up and running, as well as pet. During encounter may have to kill sharks, some as high as level 42. NOTE: Watch out for killer shark, it cannot be rooted and chain dispels. Will path near NPCs have to speak with underwater. Does see invis. Need to bring friends to kill it or be extremely vigilant in avoiding it. Personal Sidenote: Having done this first part as level 30 Iksar, all need is invis (or invis vs animals) as well as sow and enduring breath, and stay all way at bottom of sea. Scary to watch killer shark swim above you, but shouldn't agro. Rodfar, 30 Ogre, Blue -- Did this as level 30 ogre, stayed on bottom of ocean, 0 invis, eb neck item. Nothing agro'd. Didn't even see killer shark. Took 40 mins from time handed Ooglyn gem until final spirit gave another gem.

steps.notes: Ooglyn says 'Ooooh, it you, shaman. Me's been waitin for you cuz our frenz say you comin an need da test. So's I gib you da test. Hmm, now where me put it? Ooglyn been waiting for sign for so long dat me forget where me put test. Keep your eyes out for sign while me look for test. Oh, hey, shaman, they gib you gem? I need dat gem, please, heheh.' After giving gem: 'Ahhh, tank you, now me can...OH LOOK!! DA SIGN!!!! Oh, sorry you missed it. Sign show you where to wait for da test. Follow me...I like you so I take you there. We goin for a swim, shaman!' Follow Ooglyn. Will swim past ruined boat and eventually end up at bottom of ocean at location -1600, +4200. If accidentally lose her, just go to location. Might be waiting there and might not. Either way, doesn't matter. Summon pet if plan to fight sharks or cast Invisibility/Invisibility versus Animals if want to try and avoid them. Note some killer sharks see through invisibility. Neither strategy necessary as long as stay on sea floor at location. Hung out there whole time with pet up and didn't catch any agro, despite killer shark swimming directly above. Also worth mentioning: Some of following NPC's will tell you to follow them, and then swim away. DO NOT. They are trying to trick you into leaving your spot in your 'Test of Patience.' Just be patient, as Shaman should be. 'Ok, here is place for you to for waiting. Hab fun shaman!'

steps.description: Wait at location -1600, +4200 in Erud's Crossing

location.description: Bottom of ocean

steps.notes: During course of this event many NPC's will spawn, asking you to follow them. Do NOT move from this spot or will have to start over. Do not actually have to talk to any NPC's, just have to wait. Four minutes later, Srafen the Soaked will appear. Three minutes after Srafen appears, Dillon the Drowned will appear. 11 minutes after Dillon appears, Srafen will speak. 3 minutes after Srafen speaks, he will say this and depart. 3 minutes later, Froham the Forgotten appears. Froham will not respond to any more attempts at conversation. 6 minutes after he appears, he will depart. 5 minutes later, Abe the Abandoned will appear. 4 minutes after he appears, Abe will say something. 3 minutes later, Abe will depart. 3-4 minutes later greater spirit will spawn. Only one shaman can benefit from Test of Patience at a time

steps.description: Give Broken Arrow to A Greater Spirit (if received from Abe)

npc.name: A Greater Spirit
npc.notes: Says 'You have walked path of patience and you now know what to expect. We are watchers. Our eyes are everywhere and we must be patient and quiet else we may miss what could be harmful. Can you sit still quietly and wait for just right moment, then open your eyes with fury and act with all energy you have cultivated? Timing is everything, and without patience you cannot be sensitive to timing. You have shown your patience here and we believe you are ready to walk [next path].' 'You know trust and patience. But before we can allow you to act in our name, we must know that when you do decide to act, you will make right choices. We must ask that you now walk path of wisdom. You must walk to great plains and search out one of us. He is wanderer, and it is his nature to drift with winds and weather doing what he can to ensure understanding and longevity to all that respect their home. He will not be easy to find, though, and you must remember what you have learned down here to succeed in finding him. When you do, give him this gem and follow his instructions.' At this point, spirit will despawn immediately, unlike steps before it

steps.notes: As for broken arrow, there is no use for it in P99 but has been used much later in EQ live

npc.notes: Stops and flashes brightly for moment. Seems to be regarding you with interest. Says 'Oh, it is you, shaman! Good! You must hurry before it's too late. Go now to Mountains they call Rathe and find them! They need your help quickly! They will know you when they see you and instruct you on how you can help, but you must hurry!'

npc.name: A Wandering Spirit

location.description: Generally between Qeynos hills and bandit camp in mountains

npc.notes: Says 'You are close to passing test, keep up good work.' 'It is unfortunate that it came to this, but nothing else was to be done. Both paragons had lost sight of their virtues to protect items given to them. Mere protection of these material belongings was not as important to Mithaniel Marr or Bertoxulous as it was that they act with righteousness in their minds and purpose in their hearts. You saw this and acted accordingly. For that, we will reward you with three treasures made into one to ward off falsehood of possession, [Shield of Falsehood]. You have walked path and now, as your final test, we must set you along one [last path].' 'Yes, I have taken Marr's Promise along with Woe and Envy and fashioned them together to create Shield of Falsehood. Wield this in defense of possession and weakness that comes with hoarding treasure instead of using it to accomplish your goals. May it serve you well.' 'You have trusted us along paths we have set before you. You have been known to be patient and await right moment. And now, you have learned wisdom to act in our best interest. However, one last path awaits, to determine if you have ability to act out what must be done. There are many troubles about world we try to rub out but none is more serious than curse on what wasichu call Emerald Jungle. Go there and find one of our spirits. Show them gem you have been given and follow path they set you on.'

steps.description: Give Sparkling Gem to Spirit Sentinel in Emerald Jungle

npc.name: Spirit Sentinel

location.description: Cylinder shaped building

dialogue: Say 'I will continue what I have started'

'This brings happiness to our hearts and we are grateful. However, we must ask you to walk one more path before you can become true Heyokah. With trust, one can focus on what is important. With patience, one can perceive what is harmful. With wisdom, one can know what must be done. These, you have learned, yet without might to carry out what must be done, all is for naught. Are you [prepared to walk path of might]?'

steps.description: Give Black Dire Pelt to Spirit Sentinel in Emerald Jungle

npc.name: Spirit Sentinel
dialogue: Say 'How can we rub it out?'
Say 'I will find how it all began'
npc.notes: Begins to weep softly as sees pelt, battered and bloody. After few moments, says, 'We can only hope his passing was quick and painless. Dire was powerful and yet you overcame him. Always remember that when you became [Heyokah], it was passing of noble, yet misguided being that allowed you to do so. You should hold special place in heart for him and what he was in life. To help you remember him, we will fashion this pelt into pair of boots and give them to you. With every step you take, you must think on Dire, else his death be in vain forever.' 'Yes, you have walked Path of Heyokah to its end. You have become what few have and we will now call to you as Heyokah. From now on, you are direct link between spirits and man. Whether your goals are to help us or master us, you are welcomed. Though there is little time for celebration. Do you feel darkness of this place, forest? To eyes not trained to see beyond physical appearances, it seems like any other forest. But you know, as do we, of mantle over city threatening all of us. We must [rub it out].' 'There are many such mantles scarring universe and each is very different from last. Removing them requires that we learn how they were created and go about reversing damage done. We cannot enter under mantle for long which is why we search out Heyokah such as yourself. We need you to enter city and find out what you can about [city's demise]. We hope you will do this for cause of balance but if you desire none but your own power, we shall grant that as well.' 'It was known as Torsis. During its history it amassed great wealth and power yet it eventually crumbled. No one understands what happened. Men of world ask themselves how nation as successful as Torsis could ever fall. Some blame plague, internal unrest, constant encroachment of forest, and marauding bands of monsters but we alone know what happened. Just as Tabien and Glaron lost sight of their spiritual paths, so did Torsis. Without awe and inspiration of that which was greater than themselves, they eventually withered away. Mantle was born long before last days, though, and what we need to learn is [how it all began].' 'Excellent! Go into city and gather what evidence you can. Ghosts who still walk streets may hoard precious memories that will aid us. Take this booklet and combine what you find in it. Then bring me completed report. From there, we will know where to look next.' NOTE: It appears spirit can give you container before faction good enough for him to accept it back when have combined product - apparently should not try to do these hand ins before KINDLY faction

We need to learn what happened to queen. Perhaps bringing this knowledge to King's now cursed form will lift mantle. We've learned that last lord of Torsis, Ghiosk, was bit of historian. Find him and see what you can learn about queen. Take what you find to my brother here In jungle beneath murky waters of pond.' If hand combined pages in at Amiable faction: 'This is sad day. You have failed and strayed from path set before you. Please try to live as close to spirits as you are able, though this is closest you will ever get.'

steps.description: Obtain Icon of the High Scale from City of Mist

location.description: Ground spawn in temple. Go into City of Mist. Go across bridge. Open gate. Turn right. Go straight forward through 2 arches. In last room will find temple with waterfall running down its side. Stay in courtyard of temple, and pull skeletons, etc., from first door see at base of temple. Open door. Inside is another door directly in front, do not open this door, leads to top of temple. Look instead to right, where three skeletons spawn. Pull these skeletons to courtyard and kill them. Go back into door, head right and see room set below ground level with three phantoms in it, standing on raised dais. Pull and kill these phantoms. There are two doors beside dais, one opening to left and one opening to right. Choose left door. Inside is small room with no monsters inside, and small bag on floor in left corner. Click on bag, now have High Scale Icon. Gate out. Using Invisibility to Undead potion (Unlife Awareness) will get past last three skeletons and phantoms. They will still scowl at you, ready to attack, but is bluff. They will NOT be able to see you. Be warned, however, as golems of area can see through Invisibility to Undead, and may run across couple on way to temple area. There were no rogue-locked doors between zone and High Scale icon

steps.description: Give Icon of the High Scale to High Scale Kirn in The Hole

npc.name: High Scale Kirn

location.description: Tower beyond city. Check map. Kirn is #3. Respawn time is four hours. As far as getting to Kirn, there are two options. Option 1: Yael drop down. Method should take about 20-30 minutes. Drop down from Paineel into Yaels pit. Some people able to survive fall, others not. If drop down and immediately run into water won't agro surrounding mobs. From here follow tunnel up to undead tower. Kill roaming golem / elementals and then IVU up to flat before Kirn. Option 2: Work way through city. Method can take up to 2 hours. Eventually come to open area with tower off in distance. Open area has 2 spawns - rock golem and elemental. Kill those, move up. Have 6 minutes. Open area faces tower and dips down, flattening in bottom before rising again towards tower. In this area before tower come across few roamers. Destination is ahead. Work way to base of tower. In front of castle are two spawns - revenant/wanderers. Now have choice: 1) Invisibility versus Undead - Keeper of Tomb in left hand courtyard of revenant tower will eat 2-3 groups alive if agro him. Good news is Invisibility versus Undead works in tower (even though some revenants will scowl at you, they will not attack). Go through gate, run through middle main doors of tower and to back where single door opens to stairs leading upward. Follow this up couple flights to Kirn himself, then drop invisibility in his room. Disadvantage is can be messy if couple raid members have invisibility drop on them and die. Make SURE everybody knows before hand to let people die if get attacked - just drag corpses up and rez them once situated. 2) Kill way through (be wary of Keeper). Pull to flat to prevent continuously fighting 6 minute respawns at top. May be tough as attract all roamers from Master Yael tunnel. If have been tearing through mobs previously, should be no problem progressing and moving up tower. However, if not killing very fast probably should not pull inside of tower for one or two rotations. Split up spawn from this area first. Next, wait until two revenants at doorway spawn and then kill them. Then have 6 minutes to kill around 3 revenants in first room of tower. Trick here is move inside. Do not try to pull great portion of tower to outside; respawn rate and number of mobs likely to be too high. Work way up to Kirn. Once get to High Scale Kirn, kill three revanants in aggro range. Since Kirn is indifferent should not be using area effect spells of any kind

npc.notes: Looks down at icon in hands for long moment before speaking. 'Why did you bring me this? Are you here to accuse me of queen's death?' Chuckles venomously and continues, 'I am High Scale and beyond your petty laws. However, I wish truth to be known. On my hand is ring. If you can take it from me, show it to queen and she will remember. However, I will not give up ring easily. Defend yourself!' Kirn is initially non-KoS, but will attack instant hand him Icon, so above conversation will fly by. NOTE: THIS TURN IN REQUIRES TRUE SPIRIT FACTION. IT CANNOT BE MQ'd BY SOMEONE WITHOUT TP FACTION

If we put child to rest, Rak may repent of what he has done and mantle may be lifted. Most difficult task is now at hand. Find child, then take proof of her passing to Rak. If don't have max ally faction to point where notified 'Your faction standing with True Spirit can not get any better' will have scale eaten. Says 'What is this? Scale of Rak'Ashiir's father? Then Rak has repented his mistake? But why is mantle still in place? If Rak has repented, then mantle should have dissolved since he was one who initiated its construction. But is its initiation key? How could we have been so blind? Kirn said Rak'Ashiir had blood of his people on his hands but that is false. Rak merely pointed to path that would lead them to destruction. It was people who chose to follow.' 'Mantle was product of thousands of faithless individuals. Not single shroud we believed existed. Torsis is now truly cursed for all eternity as great stain upon universe. Today is sad day, indeed. However, some good can still come of this. Your sacrifice and spiritual devotion in this matter have become legendary. You have waited for us at bottom of ocean. You have rubbed out mighty rogue spirit. You have endured black hole of Torsis and entered abode of Fear itself to save child from eternal suffering. It is only fitting that we reward you with our greatest treasure, [Spear of Fate].'

Giants don't particularly like to trade with us smaller folks, but there is one old miner named Mentrax Mountainbone who has traded with me in past. Go find him and tell him Wenden sent you.'

location.description: Aviak Island

npc.notes: Says 'Hello. I am Denken Strongpick. I wish I could get off this rock, silly clan honor. My boss broke our rebreathers and we can not go back to mainland before we gather some goblin relics.' 'There are supposedly goblin ruins around here somewhere. Fendlemend thinks we will find paydirt underwater. We did find one thing.' 'We found very fine sword blade.' Denken pulls open pack and shows razor sharp sword covered with runes. 'I can't figure out what type of metal it is and I sure can't figure out what technique was used to forge it. Perhaps you would like to take it off my hands and [buy] it?' 'Out here, money is fairly useless to me. You see, I can't leave Fendlemend out here alone. I signed on with very detailed contract. I could sure [use] few things from mainland though.' Travel to fortress where children of Rallos were first cursed by Rathe and bring me heart of one of goblins who have made it their new home. npc.notes: Says 'Ah, I see you have found my study. This is where I study and scribe history of magic in Norrath.' 'I have worked to chronicle everything from beginnings of magic to what we consider modern day of magic. Solusek Ro has been very generous to those who wield magic in Norrath. But throughout history there is one thing I have noticed - too much power corrupts soul. I have seen and documented that strongest wizards and those closest to Solusek Ro become corrupted by their power.' 'Unfortunately, I don't have time to speak of such things right now. But I could use your help since you are here. I have here envelope that I need delivered to one Camin Rah. You can find Camin in wizard tower in city of Erudin. He is sage like myself whose knowledge rivals my own. Do you [agree] to undertake my task?.' 'Here you are, then. Good luck on your journey.'

steps.notes: OPTIONAL - this exact step is not absolutely required. Identifies as 'I've found what we've been searching for!' Reads: 'Hello, old friend, I have made updated list and locations of items required for my research. Dragon bones- Plane of Fear Jet Black egg- Unknown Mistletoe powder- Old Sebilis Rune of Lost Thought- Unknown Contact me when you find them Solomen'

steps.description: Give Note to Camin to Camin in Erudin

npc.name: Camin

location.description: Vasty Deep Inn. To find him, simply open front door and go up stairs to right. Go down hall and open first door on left. Camin will be behind door. On Truespirit faction (similar to Beta Neutral - no faction for killing him and starts non-KOS to all)

npc.notes: Says 'So you have met Solomen, eh? He is man with wealth of knowledge. It is good to hear he is well.' 'Go away! I have no time for you!' 'Ah! Smart one, I see! If you really wish to know about such thing, you will have to help me finance my studies. Knowledge I have acquired and researched did not come cheaply.' OPTIONAL - this step is not required; it's only needed to find out information about quest, but that information is already listed here. Just need to have sufficient TrueSpirit faction to continue quest. NOTE: Doing this part twice is NOT enough faction to get you to indifferent

steps.description: Give 1000 Platinum to Camin

npc.name: Camin
npc.notes: Says 'Good, good, you show willingness to learn of this with your offer. What I can tell you is that Solusek Ro had four followers who had shown exceptional aptitude in arts of wizardry. Solusek Ro himself tutored them. He considered them to be like his own children. I know of one who still exists. He goes by name of Arantir Karondor. He used to specialize in storing of magic into physical objects. Arantir has been hiding for many, many years and will most assuredly be going by another name, so keep your eyes open. Anyway, be off, I need to continue my research. Return to me if you ever find Arantir Karondor.'

steps.description: Purchase Ro's Breath from Dargon in Halas

npc.name: Dargon

location.description: Female NPC vendor in front of Shaman guild

npc.notes: Purchase potion called Ro's Breath for sum of about 900pp to 1100pp depending on faction and charisma. Identifies as 'Powerful magic radiates from this object.'

steps.description: Give Ro's Breath to Camin

npc.name: Camin
npc.notes: Says 'Very interesting... I've seen this work before. Yes, yes! It's work of Arantir Karondor! Give this back to person you got it from. Maybe he will have clue to Arantir's location.' Gives back potion (now identifies as 'I know who you are.'). Only difference is that it no longer has charge of Shield of Lava. Cannot skip previous trip to Camin. Absolutely must hand potion to Camin. If try to skip trip to Erudin, will get following message from Dargon: 'I didn't request this item, but thank you very much'

steps.description: Give used Ro's Breath to Dargon

npc.name: Dargon
npc.notes: Turns into blue robe adorned Arantir Karondor and replies: 'So, I've been discovered! You must know Camin - he is one of only people who could have recognized my work. I have worked very hard to mask my presence here.' Note more than one wizard can hail Arantir after he has been triggered and each receive ring

steps.description: Hail Arantir Karondor

npc.name: Arantir Karondor
npc.notes: Says 'Before I tell you anything, I require you to help me. Seek woman named Challice. Give her this letter and then return to me.' Arantir will despawn in three minutes. So if want him to stay there while go to Felwithe, have friend stay with Arantir and continue to talk to him while gone. If does despawn then must wait for another wizard to make him spawn, but do not have to keep him up in order to complete quest

steps.notes: Actually ring called Arantir's Ring. Identifying it reveals: 'Item Lore: My love has no bounds.'

steps.description: Give Arantir's Ring to Challice in Felwithe

npc.name: Challice

location.description: Basement of Paladin Guild

npc.notes: Says 'Oh yes? Arantir? What fool he was! Man gave me everything, but for all his intelligence, he could never understand why I was truly with him. It was for his power; he could do anything. But when he mysteriously lost it, he became just another toy. I never loved him. Return this ring to him. He will understand that I have no desire to see him again.'

steps.notes: Gets different version of ring back (identifies as 'I never could love man like you.'). Can hand it to either version of Arantir. Handing it into Dargon will spawn real version

steps.description: Give returned ring to Dargon/Arantir Karondor

npc.name: Dargon / Arantir Karondor
dialogue: Say 'I wish to hear your story'
npc.notes: If gotten back to him quickly, before has despawned, after hailing him gives another ring. If then despawns before get chance to ask about gnome, can repeat handing ring in to Challice and then return to Halas to turn ring in to Dargon to get Arantir to spawn again. Says 'Ah, but it pains my heart to see this. How I could love women like that is beyond me. And yet, I still do love her. It was on day I was to ask her to marry me that I lost my powers. When I was about to cast my greatest spell to prove my love to her, my magic failed. She ran out on me that day. But enough of me, do you wish to hear my story?' 'I once was one of four true followers of Solusek Ro. So great were four of us that Solusek Ro himself made us each special item. We did not know what others' items were, but we realized that was for our own safety. Each one of us, after receiving item, began to plot against Solusek Ro. Each of us believed we had enough power to dominate Norrath. Solusek Ro saw this and at time we needed our powers most, he stripped us of them. Now I know two of other wizards by name. One was called Sylen Tyrn, other's name was Demunir Scry. Last wizard was gnome, but I can't think of his name.'

steps.notes: Says 'Talk to him of other wizards and receive Note from Arantir. (Say 'Who is the gnome?' to skip to end of conversation)'

steps.description: Kill Phinigel Autropos in Kedge Keep

mob.name: Phinigel Autropos
mob.notes: Level 50 Wizard. Actually quite easy to kill. If have support, this part isn't hard to do. Surrounded by guards, that can be solo pulled by 60. Phinny can be done with one well structured group of level 58s plus. There are many tactics to killing Phinny. Most used and most reliable is single pulling guardians fast. They repop every 20 minutes so if don't go fast enough, will have to start over. Once dispatched, pull Phinny. He himself isn't very hard to kill. Helps to have someone to slow. If doing this with one group, need shaman, enchanter, warrior, cleric, yourself, and preferably damage meleer such as monk, rogue, or ranger. Trace of Sylen Tyrn can be found on Phinigel Autropos. Blue Crystal Staff is what need. It's one of Phinigel's rare drops so in for 'fun' camp

steps.description: Kill Venril Sathir in Karnor's Castle

mob.name: Venril Sathir
mob.notes: 55 Warrior with approximately 18,000 hitpoints. Hardly anything, but regeneration is amazing. Basically have to kill him within first 20 seconds, or else hard to win fight. Have to realize that 18khp is hardly anything. Has 2 personal clerics which heal him and never seem to run out of mana. Might be smart to have designated group that would kill these before helping other groups with Venril. Best type of spells to cast on him are cold and fire because doesn't have as strong resistances in those type of spells. Has 1000 lifetap punches which can be very dangerous also. Basically need strong guild to kill him and be able to loot staff, if drops. Item need is Gnarled Staff which can be found on Venril Sathir. It's his uncommon drop

steps.description: Give Note from Arantir to Kandin Firepot in Butcherblock Mountains

npc.name: Kandin Firepot

location.description: Near ocean. -1491, +2843 by docks

npc.notes: Says 'Brother! I have one of those. He's great, but he's dead. His name was Gabstik and he was really powerful wizard. I still have one of his greatest possessions! You look like you could use it. I've added another item to my shopping list. I require dry brittle skin that I can mold or rare oil found in planes that I must soak fuse in. Get me one of these things and I'll trade it for my brother's stick.' 'Hello, there! Don't have time to talk. I'm workin', workin', workin'! Careful! Don't slip in oil!' 'Ah the oil! I recently sent specially crafted golem to explore through huge portal to another plane. Its instructions were to collect special oil that I suspect existed in plane. What I think is golem broke down. This looks like good task for one like you. Go see what's wrong with golem. Here are spare gears of mine in case it's broken. Be careful though, if you put it in wrong it could explode, or worse!'

steps.notes: This quest requires faction. Post-Revamp Method: There is now new way can get Staff of Gabstik and note to Arantir. Instead of handing Kandin note from Arantir, Hail him and say 'what oil?' and Kandin will give Golem Sprocket

steps.description: Give Golem Sprocket to A Broken Golem in Plane of Fear

npc.name: A Broken Golem
npc.notes: Golem speaks of is called broken golem in Plane of Fear

steps.description: Kill An Enraged Golem

mob.name: An Enraged Golem
mob.notes: Now in place of broken golem is enraged golem. Double hits for 400 and has around 150k hit points. Will need many tanks and clerics. Casters not necessary, but can sometimes put dent into hp. Does not cast so don't need to worry about resists. Says 'Error! Malfunction! Destroy!' 'Wizards like you always bring out worst in me.' This will be LONG fight

steps.description: Give Green Oil to Kandin Firepot

npc.name: Kandin Firepot
npc.notes: Says 'Oh wow! You found oil! Where is golem? You didn't hurt him did you? I am very fond of him. Anyways, here is your reward note and staff to give to that guy you were asking me about.'

steps.description: Kill Cazic Thule in Plane of Fear

mob.name: Cazic Thule
mob.notes: Pre-Revamp method. Note: If have Cazic's Skin from before revamp, can still turn it into Kandin to get Kandin's Bag, which can turn into him to get note. Confirmed by Sesserdrix, 6/21/2023 on Blue

steps.description: Give Cazic's Skin to Kandin Firepot

npc.name: Kandin Firepot
npc.notes: Says 'Great! This is? What is this for again? Oh yeah, casing for my firework. Here, you can have this then, oh no, wait. You can't yet. I forgot I needed another part to my firework, and you are exactly person to get it for me! I need some mistletoe powder. Now, go find some for me! Go, go, go, go! Shoo! Oh, wait! Hold on to my bag for me, please. You can give it back after you've given me what I want.'

steps.notes: When identified, bag comes up with: 'Item Lore: Warning - Explosive!' Although is bag, cannot be opened. Don't worry about this, continue with quest

steps.description: Kill Tolapumj in Old Sebilis
Give Mistletoe Powder to Kandin Firepot

npc.name: Kandin Firepot
npc.notes: Upon handing Kandin mistletoe powder, will return Staff of Gabstik. Once hands you staff asks for bag back

steps.description: Give Kandin's Bag back to Kandin Firepot

npc.name: Kandin Firepot
npc.notes: Says 'Great! Give this to Arantir so he knows you've helped me! Hey! Have you seen my lantern anywhere?'

steps.notes: Identifies as 'Give him a fish!' Reads: 'The fish thank you for people you sent me! Oh also if you ever come across my lantern please let me know.'

steps.description: Give Note to Arantir to Dargon

npc.name: Dargon
npc.notes: Arantir will once again appear in her place

steps.description: Give Blue Crystal Staff, Gnarled Staff, and Staff of Gabstik to Arantir Karondor

npc.name: Arantir Karondor
npc.notes: Says 'Ah yes, you again. Do you have items? Give me three you possess and I'll combine them with my own.' 'Here, this pack contains all of our items. You will never be able to open it again, so you must deliver pack, intact, to Solomen. He will then reward you. Now that I have helped you, leave me in peace.' Make sure they are right ones! Some of these staves icons look like other staves that aren't needed in quest. If give him wrong ones then will have to start over

steps.notes: Identifies as 'Godlike magic radiates from this bag'

steps.description: Give Magically Sealed Bag to Solomen

npc.name: Solomen
npc.notes: Says 'You actually did it! I never would have thought that anyone could have truly followed this path. This is tribute to your intelligence and patience. Here, take this staff and know that you have made Solusek Ro and all wizards of world proud this day.' Final faction hit is in fact negative
